topic.title: HP Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade 1.1: Applying the Helion Dynamic Password Patch

body.section:
The HP Helion OpenStack cloud deployment creates a default password to log into the Helion interface.
You can deploy a patch to configure the installer to generate a dynamic user name and password for the Helion interface. The user name can password can be retrieved from a configuration files. You should have downloaded the patch files in the Prerequisites.
Note: You need the Ubuntu patch utility installed on the HLM host. If you do not have the utility installed, use the following command:apt-get install patch
To apply the patch:
Copy the horizon_web_patch_1.1.tar.gz to the ~/patch_cghelion1.1 directory. cp horizon_web_patch_1.1.tar.gz ~/patch_cghelion1.1
Use the following command to extract the horizon_web_patch_1.1.tar.gz: tar -zxvf horizon_web_patch_1.1.tar.gz

section.title: Apply the patch to the Configuration Processor

ol.li: Change to the following directory: cd ~/kenobi-configuration-processor

Execute the following command to perform a dry-run of the patch to verify: patch -p1 --dry-run < ~/patch_cghelion1.1/horizon_web_patch_1.1.patch
The output appears similar to the following:checking file Data/Site/services/keystone.json

Execute the following command to apply the patch:patch -p1 < ~/patch_cghelion1.1/horizon_web_patch_1.1.patch
The output appears similar to the following:patching file Data/Site/services/keystone.json

section.title: Synchronize the Patch Files to the Environment

ol.li: Execute the following command to synch the patch file:./hlm_prepare-env.sh
